commitResults.messageTitle: Dupe Chatbot Skeleton: rename and add greeting/exit skeleton
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename the chatbot from "Duke" to a "Dupe".

Implement a basic skeletal version of the Dupe chatbot that:
* greets the user upon starting
* prints a prompt asking what it can do for the user
* exits with a exit message

commitResults.messageTitle: Revert "Dupe Chatbot Skeleton: rename and add greeting/exit skeleton"
Dupe Chatbot Skeleton: rename and add greeting/exit skeleton
commitResults.messageBody:
Rename the chatbot from the placeholder "Duke" to "Dupe".

Implement a basic skeletal version of the chatbot that:
* greets the user upon starting
* prints a prompt asking what it can do for the user
* exits an exit message

commitResults.messageTitle: Echo function: Echos user inputs and exits when the user types "bye".
commitResults.messageBody: Reads in user input to echo back to user. Exits when user input is "bye"

commitResults.messageTitle: Task.java: Created Task class with basic methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Task object has a String description and a Boolean isDone

Task class has various methods such as:
* getStatusIcon()
* markAsDone()
* markAsNotDone()
* toString()

commitResults.messageTitle: Initialise Task Array List: Created taskArrayList, 3 task objects in the taskArrayList
commitResults.messageBody:
The method to initialise the array list and the task objects is initialiseTask()

The task added are:
* read book
* return book
* buy book

commitResults.messageTitle: listTasks(): Created listTasks() method that list the various task
commitResults.messageBody: If user enters "list" the list of task will be printed.

commitResults.messageTitle: mark/unmark function: Created mark() and unmark() function
commitResults.messageBody:
mark/unmark function adds and removes the "X" respectively.

If user input is mark or unmark, it reads splits the string and reads the TaskID specified and mark/unmark accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Changed the formating of the toString() method slightly
ToDos.java: Created ToDos class that inherits from Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a todo command that creates todo tasks and add it into the list

Todo class:
* Overrides toString() method and adds a "[T]"

commitResults.messageTitle: Removed initalisation of task since we have the add task method todo().
Deadlines.java: Created Deadlines class that inherits from Task class & Created a taskOutputMsg() method instead since it will be used multiple times
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a deadline command that creates deadline tasks and add it into the list

Deadline class:
* Overrides toString() method and adds a "[D]" and follows the format of "description (by deadline)"

Deadline command in Dupe.java
* Reads user input and split them accordingly to description and deadline

commitResults.messageTitle: Events.java: Created Events class that inherits from Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a event command that creates event tasks and add it into the list

Events class:
* Overrides toString() method and adds a "[D]" and follows the format of "description (from: .... to: ....)"

event command in Dupe.java
* Reads user input and split them accordingly to description, from, and to.

Change the spliting with a "/" before "by", "from", and "to"

commitResults.messageTitle: Created the Scanner object outside of the loop instead of inside the loop
A-TextUiTesting: Edited input.txt for
Revert "A-TextUiTesting: Edited input.txt for"
A-TextUiTesting: Edited input.txt and EXPECTED.txt for A-TextUiTesting
Error Handling: If the commands are incomplete, an error message will be printed
commitResults.messageBody:
Ensures that the chatbot does not break even if user fails to follow the expect command format.
For example:
user input: "todo" (without a description)
chatbot: "Please enter a description"

commitResults.messageTitle: Error Handling: If user inputs a invalid command, the chatbot will send an error message
commitResults.messageBody:
Commands other than:
* bye
* list
* mark
* unmark
* todo
* deadline
* event

will recieve an "Invalid Command" error message

commitResults.messageTitle: Delete task function: Created a delete task command
commitResults.messageBody:
Command to delete task specified by the user

Added Error handling for delete command:
* User have to specify the task he wants to delete, else an error message will pop up

commitResults.messageTitle: Error Handling: Added a isInRange() method to check if the task specified exist
commitResults.messageBody: Implemented it in mark, unmark, and delete function

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Dupe.java with loadList() method: loads/create .data/tasks.txt into ArrayList.
Update Dupe.java with saveList() method: Save the tasks in the hard disk automatically whenever the task list changes
Update all the different types of tasks.java files with savedListFormat(): The task saved will be in the format of "Type | isDone | Description | ..."
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7' for Level 7
Update Deadlines.java and Dupe.java: Implemented java.time.LocalDateTime to accept dates in "dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm" format and print in "MMM dd yyyy" format
Update Events.java and Dupe.java: Implemented java.time.LocalDateTime to accept dates in "dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm" format and print in "MMM dd yyyy" format
Update Dupe.java: Handle DateTimeParseException and print out error message
Merge branch 'branch-Level-8' for Level 8
